revised_title: Surface Energy and Surface Tension in Solids and Liquids: A General Theory
tldr: This article presents a general theory of surface energy and surface tension in both liquids and solids. The author extends Rayleigh's theory of surface tension and presents a simple and clear explanation of how surface tension arises from cohesive attraction. The article also covers the historical development of capillarity theories and provides a comprehensive understanding of surface energy and surface tension in various materials.
